intro: Dimorphanthera peekelii, commonly known as the Peckel's dimorphanthera, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of pink and white. It typically grows as an erect shrub with smooth, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
